column1: Because some of these topics show up on many individual place forums, here they are in one post. The professional expertise cited in these articles may vary, so I'm not vouching for them to be scientifically or medically correct, but just of general interest. -- Overall health.https:/…art-20486965 -- When can we go on a cruise again? I can’t believe anyone is actually asking, but they must be since articles have appeared about that subject. I thought I’d add this tool to help travelers. It assesses the chance someone will have Covid around you depending the county and number of people. So if you think 30 other people will be at the outdoor restaurant you’re going to put in 30. If 200 people are in the Costco put in 200. Obviously it’s not foolproof as it’s based on averages which can change moment to moment. https://covid19risk.biosci.gatech.edu/…
According to some immunologists, plane travel is pretty safe. Personally I don't trust that the airlines clean their filters as often as they say they do. https:/…flying-in-the-age-of-covid-19

I have no idea how often they maintain the air filters. Even in the VERY best of times, sitting in rows of cramped seats, in almost full-body shoulder-to-ankle contact with a stranger on one or BOTH sides, is a nightmare. Bad enough that people are sealed up together in that container with common cold or flu viruses.For the foreseeable future, if I can't get to a place by car, bicycle, foot, or Amtrak with a sleeping cabin or guaranteed safe radius, it isn't a place I need to go.
